author: Sam Sacks
title: Fiction Chronicle: Love Among the Higher Primates
text:
The theory that Dr. Francine Burk advances in Audrey Schulman’s novel “Theory of Bastards” (Europa Editions, 403 pages, $18) is that there are enough long-term evolutionary benefits to conceiving children outside of marriage to make women risk the stigma of adultery, a proposal so controversial that Burk becomes a celebrity in her field and lands a well-endowed position at a Missouri primate foundation to do the sort of thing evolutionary biologists dream about—observing the mating behavior of bonobo chimps.
